info.title: Infoblox IPAM API
info.description: OpenAPI specification for Infoblox NIOS WAPI IPAM objects

get.description: Returns a list of ipv4address objects matching the search criteria

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Comment for the address; maximum 256 characters.

parameters.name: dhcp_client_identifier
parameters.description: The client unique identifier.

parameters.name: fingerprint
parameters.description: DHCP fingerprint for the address.

parameters.name: ip_address
parameters.description: The IP address.

parameters.name: is_conflict
parameters.description: If set to True, the IP address has either a MAC address conflict or a DHCP lease conflict detected through a network discovery.

parameters.name: lease_state
parameters.description: The lease state of the address.

parameters.name: mac_address
parameters.description: The MAC address.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: The DNS names. For example, if the IP address belongs to a host record, this field contains the hostname. This field supports both single and array search.

parameters.name: network
parameters.description: The network to which this address belongs, in FQDN/CIDR format.

parameters.name: network_view
parameters.description: The name of the network view.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The current status of the address.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: The types of associated objects. This field supports both single and array search.

parameters.name: usage
parameters.description: Indicates whether the IP address is configured for DNS or DHCP. This field supports both single and array search.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user who created or modified the record.

get.description: Returns a list of network objects matching the search criteria

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Comment for the network, maximum 256 characters.

parameters.name: discovered_bgp_as
parameters.description: Number of the discovered BGP AS. When multiple BGP autonomous systems are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

parameters.name: discovered_bridge_domain
parameters.description: Discovered bridge domain.

parameters.name: discovered_tenant
parameters.description: Discovered tenant.

parameters.name: discovered_vlan_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the discovered VLAN. When multiple VLANs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

parameters.name: discovered_vlan_name
parameters.description: The name of the discovered VLAN. When multiple VLANs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

parameters.name: discovered_vrf_description
parameters.description: Description of the discovered VRF. When multiple VRFs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

parameters.name: discovered_vrf_name
parameters.description: The name of the discovered VRF. When multiple VRFs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

parameters.name: discovered_vrf_rd
parameters.description: Route distinguisher of the discovered VRF. When multiple VRFs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

parameters.name: discovery_engine_type
parameters.description: The network discovery engine type.

parameters.name: ipv4addr
parameters.description: The IPv4 Address of the network.

parameters.name: network
parameters.description: The network address in IPv4 Address/CIDR format. For regular expression searches, only the IPv4 Address portion is supported. Searches for the CIDR portion is always an exact match. For example, both network containers 10.0.0.0/8 and 20.1.0.0/16 are matched by expression '.0' and only 20.1.0.0/16 is matched by '.0/16'.

parameters.name: network_container
parameters.description: The network container to which this network belongs (if any).

parameters.name: network_view
parameters.description: The name of the network view in which this network resides.

parameters.name: rir
parameters.description: The registry (RIR) that allocated the network address space.

parameters.name: rir_organization
parameters.description: The RIR organization assoicated with the network.

parameters.name: unmanaged
parameters.description: Determines whether the DHCP IPv4 Network is unmanaged or not.

ReturnFields.name: _return_fields
ReturnFields.description: Enter the field names followed by comma

ReturnFieldsPlus.name: _return_fields+
ReturnFieldsPlus.description: Enter the field names followed by comma, this returns the required fields along with the default fields

MaxResults.name: _max_results
MaxResults.description: Enter the number of results to be fetched

ReturnAsObject.name: _return_as_object
ReturnAsObject.description: Select 1 if result is required as an object

PageId.name: _page_id
PageId.description: Page id for retrieving next page of results

Schema.name: _schema
Schema.description: Return schema for this object type

Inheritance.name: _inheritance
Inheritance.description: If this option is set to True, fields which support inheritance, will display data properly.

value.description: The value of the extensible attribute.

ExtAttrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object.

comment.description: Comment for the address; maximum 256 characters.

discover_now_status.description: Discover now status for this address.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

is_conflict.description: If set to True, the IP address has either a MAC address conflict or a DHCP lease conflict detected through a network discovery.

is_invalid_mac.description: This flag reflects whether the MAC address for this address is invalid.

lease_state.description: The lease state of the address.

names.description: The DNS names. For example, if the IP address belongs to a host record, this field contains the hostname. This field supports both single and array search.

network.description: The network to which this address belongs, in FQDN/CIDR format.

network_view.description: The name of the network view.

objects.description: The objects associated with the IP address.

reserved_port.description: The reserved port for the address.

status.description: The current status of the address.

types.description: The types of associated objects. This field supports both single and array search.

usage.description: Indicates whether the IP address is configured for DNS or DHCP. This field supports both single and array search.

username.description: The name of the user who created or modified the record.

device_model.description: The model name of the end device in the vendor terminology.

device_port_name.description: The system name of the interface associated with the discovered IP address.

device_port_type.description: The hardware type of the interface associated with the discovered IP address.

device_type.description: The type of end host in vendor terminology.

device_vendor.description: The vendor name of the end host.

discovered_name.description: The name of the network device associated with the discovered IP address.

discoverer.description: Specifies whether the IP address was discovered by a NetMRI or NIOS discovery process.

duid.description: For IPv6 address only. The DHCP unique identifier of the discovered host. This is an optional field, and data might not be included.

first_discovered.description: The date and time the IP address was first discovered in Epoch seconds format.

iprg_state.description: The status for the IP address within port redundant group.

last_discovered.description: The date and time the IP address was last discovered in Epoch seconds format.

mac_address.description: The discovered MAC address for the host. This is the unique identifier of a network device. The discovery acquires the MAC address for hosts that are located on the same network as the Grid member that is running the discovery. This can also be the MAC address of a virtual entity on a specified vSphere server.

mgmt_ip_address.description: The management IP address of the end host that has more than one IP.

netbios_name.description: The name returned in the NetBIOS reply or the name you manually register for the discovered host.

network_component_description.description: A textual description of the switch that is connected to the end device.

network_component_ip.description: The IPv4 Address or IPv6 Address of the switch that is connected to the end device.

network_component_model.description: Model name of the switch port connected to the end host in vendor terminology.

network_component_name.description: If a reverse lookup was successful for the IP address associated with this switch, the host name is displayed in this field.

network_component_port_description.description: A textual description of the switch port that is connected to the end device.

network_component_port_name.description: The name of the switch port connected to the end device.

network_component_port_number.description: The number of the switch port connected to the end device.

network_component_type.description: Identifies the switch that is connected to the end device.

network_component_vendor.description: The vendor name of the switch port connected to the end host.

open_ports.description: The list of opened ports on the IP address, represented as: "TCP: 21,22,23 UDP: 137,139". Limited to max total 1000 ports.

os.description: The operating system of the detected host or virtual entity. The OS can be one of the following: * Microsoft for all discovered hosts that have a non-null value in the MAC addresses using the NetBIOS discovery method. * A value that a TCP discovery returns. * The OS of a virtual entity on a vSphere server.

port_duplex.description: The negotiated or operational duplex setting of the switch port connected to the end device.

port_link_status.description: The link status of the switch port connected to the end device. Indicates whether it is connected.

port_speed.description: The interface speed, in Mbps, of the switch port.

port_status.description: The operational status of the switch port. Indicates whether the port is up or down.

port_vlan_description.description: The description of the VLAN of the switch port that is connected to the end device.

port_vlan_name.description: The name of the VLAN of the switch port.

port_vlan_number.description: The ID of the VLAN of the switch port.

v_adapter.description: The name of the physical network adapter through which the virtual entity is connected to the appliance.

v_cluster.description: The name of the VMware cluster to which the virtual entity belongs.

v_datacenter.description: The name of the vSphere datacenter or container to which the virtual entity belongs.

v_entity_name.description: The name of the virtual entity.

v_entity_type.description: The virtual entity type. This can be blank or one of the following: Virtual Machine, Virtual Host, or Virtual Center. Virtual Center represents a VMware vCenter server.

v_host.description: The name of the VMware server on which the virtual entity was discovered.

v_switch.description: The name of the switch to which the virtual entity is connected.

vlan_port_group.description: Port group which the virtual machine belongs to.

vswitch_type.description: Type of the virtual switch: standard or distributed.

vswitch_ipv6_enabled.description: Indicates the virtual switch has IPV6 enabled.

vport_name.description: Name of the network adapter on the virtual switch connected with the virtual machine.

vport_mac_address.description: MAC address of the network adapter on the virtual switch where the virtual machine connected to.

vport_mode.description: Actual mode of the network adapter on the virtual switch where the virtual machine connected to.

vswitch_segment_port_group.description: Port group of the network segment on which the current virtual machine/vport connected to.

vswitch_available_ports_count.description: Numer of available ports reported by the virtual switch on which the virtual machine/vport connected to.

vswitch_tep_type.description: Type of virtual tunnel endpoint (VTEP) in the virtual switch.

cisco_ise_security_group.description: The Cisco ISE security group name.

device_contact.description: Contact information from device on which the IP address was discovered.

ap_name.description: Discovered name of Wireless Access Point.

ap_ip_address.description: Discovered IP address of Wireless Access Point.

ap_ssid.description: Service set identifier (SSID) associated with Wireless Access Point.

endpoint_groups.description: A comma-separated list of the discovered endpoint groups.

comment.description: Comment for the address; maximum 256 characters.

discover_now_status.description: Discover now status for this address.

duid.description: DHCPv6 Unique Identifier (DUID) of the address object.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

ip_address.description: IPv6 addresses of the address object.

is_conflict.description: IP address has either a duid conflict or a DHCP lease conflict detected through a network discovery.

lease_state.description: The lease state of the address.

names.description: The DNS names. For example, if the IP address belongs to a host record, this field contains the hostname. This field supports both single and array search.

network.description: The network to which this address belongs, in FQDN/CIDR format.

network_view.description: The name of the network view.

objects.description: The objects associated with the IP address.

reserved_port.description: The reserved port for the address.

status.description: The current status of the address.

types.description: The types of associated objects. This field supports both single and array search.

usage.description: Indicates whether the IP address is configured for DNS or DHCP. This field supports both single and array search.

device_model.description: The model name of the end device in the vendor terminology.

device_port_name.description: The system name of the interface associated with the discovered IP address.

device_port_type.description: The hardware type of the interface associated with the discovered IP address.

device_type.description: The type of end host in vendor terminology.

device_vendor.description: The vendor name of the end host.

discovered_name.description: The name of the network device associated with the discovered IP address.

discoverer.description: Specifies whether the IP address was discovered by a NetMRI or NIOS discovery process.

duid.description: For IPv6 address only. The DHCP unique identifier of the discovered host. This is an optional field, and data might not be included.

first_discovered.description: The date and time the IP address was first discovered in Epoch seconds format.

iprg_state.description: The status for the IP address within port redundant group.

last_discovered.description: The date and time the IP address was last discovered in Epoch seconds format.

mac_address.description: The discovered MAC address for the host. This is the unique identifier of a network device. The discovery acquires the MAC address for hosts that are located on the same network as the Grid member that is running the discovery. This can also be the MAC address of a virtual entity on a specified vSphere server.

mgmt_ip_address.description: The management IP address of the end host that has more than one IP.

netbios_name.description: The name returned in the NetBIOS reply or the name you manually register for the discovered host.

network_component_description.description: A textual description of the switch that is connected to the end device.

network_component_ip.description: The IPv4 Address or IPv6 Address of the switch that is connected to the end device.

network_component_model.description: Model name of the switch port connected to the end host in vendor terminology.

network_component_name.description: If a reverse lookup was successful for the IP address associated with this switch, the host name is displayed in this field.

network_component_port_description.description: A textual description of the switch port that is connected to the end device.

network_component_port_name.description: The name of the switch port connected to the end device.

network_component_port_number.description: The number of the switch port connected to the end device.

network_component_type.description: Identifies the switch that is connected to the end device.

network_component_vendor.description: The vendor name of the switch port connected to the end host.

open_ports.description: The list of opened ports on the IP address, represented as: "TCP: 21,22,23 UDP: 137,139". Limited to max total 1000 ports.

os.description: The operating system of the detected host or virtual entity. The OS can be one of the following: * Microsoft for all discovered hosts that have a non-null value in the MAC addresses using the NetBIOS discovery method. * A value that a TCP discovery returns. * The OS of a virtual entity on a vSphere server.

port_duplex.description: The negotiated or operational duplex setting of the switch port connected to the end device.

port_link_status.description: The link status of the switch port connected to the end device. Indicates whether it is connected.

port_speed.description: The interface speed, in Mbps, of the switch port.

port_status.description: The operational status of the switch port. Indicates whether the port is up or down.

port_vlan_description.description: The description of the VLAN of the switch port that is connected to the end device.

port_vlan_name.description: The name of the VLAN of the switch port.

port_vlan_number.description: The ID of the VLAN of the switch port.

v_adapter.description: The name of the physical network adapter through which the virtual entity is connected to the appliance.

v_cluster.description: The name of the VMware cluster to which the virtual entity belongs.

v_datacenter.description: The name of the vSphere datacenter or container to which the virtual entity belongs.

v_entity_name.description: The name of the virtual entity.

v_entity_type.description: The virtual entity type. This can be blank or one of the following: Virtual Machine, Virtual Host, or Virtual Center. Virtual Center represents a VMware vCenter server.

v_host.description: The name of the VMware server on which the virtual entity was discovered.

v_switch.description: The name of the switch to which the virtual entity is connected.

vlan_port_group.description: Port group which the virtual machine belongs to.

vport_conf_mode.description: Configured mode of the network adapter on the virtual switch where the virtual machine connected to.

vport_speed.description: Actual speed of the network adapter on the virtual switch where the virtual machine connected to. Unit is kb.

vport_mode.description: Actual mode of the network adapter on the virtual switch where the virtual machine connected to.

vswitch_segment_port_group.description: Port group of the network segment on which the current virtual machine/vport connected to.

auto_create_reversezone.description: This flag controls whether reverse zones are automatically created when the network is added.

bootfile.description: The bootfile name for the network. You can configure the DHCP server to support clients that use the boot file name option in their DHCPREQUEST messages.

bootserver.description: The bootserver address for the network. You can specify the name and/or IP address of the boot server that the host needs to boot. The boot server IPv4 Address or name in FQDN format.

cloud_shared.description: Boolean flag to indicate if the network is shared with cloud.

comment.description: Comment for the network, maximum 256 characters.

conflict_count.description: The number of conflicts discovered via network discovery.

ddns_domainname.description: The dynamic DNS domain name the appliance uses specifically for DDNS updates for this network.

ddns_generate_hostname.description: If this field is set to True, the DHCP server generates a hostname and updates DNS with it when the DHCP client request does not contain a hostname.

ddns_server_always_updates.description: This field controls whether only the DHCP server is allowed to update DNS, regardless of the DHCP clients requests. Note that changes for this field take effect only if ddns_use_option81 is True.

ddns_ttl.description: The DNS update Time to Live (TTL) value of a DHCP network object. The TTL is a 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

ddns_update_fixed_addresses.description: By default, the DHCP server does not update DNS when it allocates a fixed address to a client. You can configure the DHCP server to update the A and PTR records of a client with a fixed address. When this feature is enabled and the DHCP server adds A and PTR records for a fixed address, the DHCP server never discards the records.

ddns_use_option81.description: The support for DHCP Option 81 at the network level.

delete_reason.description: The reason for deleting the RIR registration request.

deny_bootp.description: If set to true, BOOTP settings are disabled and BOOTP requests will be denied.

dhcp_utilization.description: The percentage of the total DHCP utilization of the network multiplied by 1000. This is the percentage of the total number of available IP addresses belonging to the network versus the total number of all IP addresses in network.

dhcp_utilization_status.description: A string describing the utilization level of the network.

disable.description: Determines whether a network is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the network is enabled.

discover_now_status.description: Discover now status for this network.

discovered_bgp_as.description: Number of the discovered BGP AS. When multiple BGP autonomous systems are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovered_vlan_id.description: The identifier of the discovered VLAN. When multiple VLANs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovered_vlan_name.description: The name of the discovered VLAN. When multiple VLANs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovered_vrf_description.description: Description of the discovered VRF. When multiple VRFs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovered_vrf_name.description: The name of the discovered VRF. When multiple VRFs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovered_vrf_rd.description: Route distinguisher of the discovered VRF. When multiple VRFs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovery_member.description: The member that will run discovery for this network.

dynamic_hosts.description: The total number of DHCP leases issued for the network.

email_list.description: The e-mail lists to which the appliance sends DHCP threshold alarm e-mail messages.

enable_ddns.description: The dynamic DNS updates flag of a DHCP network object. If set to True, the DHCP server sends DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid, and to external DNS servers.

enable_dhcp_thresholds.description: Determines if DHCP thresholds are enabled for the network.

enable_discovery.description: Determines whether a discovery is enabled or not for this network. When this is set to False, the network discovery is disabled.

enable_email_warnings.description: Determines if DHCP threshold warnings are sent through email.

enable_ifmap_publishing.description: Determines if IFMAP publishing is enabled for the network.

enable_immediate_discovery.description: Determines if the discovery for the network should be immediately enabled.

enable_pxe_lease_time.description: Set this to True if you want the DHCP server to use a different lease time for PXE clients.

enable_snmp_warnings.description: Determines if DHCP threshold warnings are send through SNMP.

endpoint_sources.description: The endpoints that provides data for the DHCP Network object.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

federated_realms.description: This field contains the federated realms associated to this network

high_water_mark.description: The percentage of DHCP network usage threshold above which network usage is not expected and may warrant your attention. When the high watermark is reached, the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

high_water_mark_reset.description: The percentage of DHCP network usage below which the corresponding SNMP trap is reset. A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The high watermark reset value must be lower than the high watermark value.

ignore_dhcp_option_list_request.description: If this field is set to False, the appliance returns all DHCP options the client is eligible to receive, rather than only the list of options the client has requested.

ignore_id.description: Indicates whether the appliance will ignore DHCP client IDs or MAC addresses. Valid values are "NONE", "CLIENT", or "MACADDR". The default is "NONE".

ignore_mac_addresses.description: A list of MAC addresses the appliance will ignore.

ipam_email_addresses.description: The e-mail lists to which the appliance sends IPAM threshold alarm e-mail messages.

ipv4addr.description: The IPv4 Address of the network.

last_rir_registration_update_sent.description: The timestamp when the last RIR registration update was sent.

lease_scavenge_time.description: An integer that specifies the period of time (in seconds) that frees and backs up leases remained in the database before they are automatically deleted. To disable lease scavenging, set the parameter to -1. The minimum positive value must be greater than 86400 seconds (1 day).

logic_filter_rules.description: This field contains the logic filters to be applied on the this network. This list corresponds to the match rules that are written to the dhcpd configuration file.

low_water_mark.description: The percentage of DHCP network usage below which the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

low_water_mark_reset.description: The percentage of DHCP network usage threshold below which network usage is not expected and may warrant your attention. When the low watermark is crossed, the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The low watermark reset value must be higher than the low watermark value.

members.description: A list of members or Microsoft (r) servers that serve DHCP for this network. All members in the array must be of the same type. The struct type must be indicated in each element, by setting the "_struct" member to the struct type.

mgm_private.description: This field controls whether this object is synchronized with the Multi-Grid Master. If this field is set to True, objects are not synchronized.

mgm_private_overridable.description: This field is assumed to be True unless filled by any conforming objects, such as Network, IPv6 Network, Network Container, IPv6 Network Container, and Network View. This value is set to False if mgm_private is set to True in the parent object.

netmask.description: The netmask of the network in CIDR format.

network.description: The network address in IPv4 Address/CIDR format. For regular expression searches, only the IPv4 Address portion is supported. Searches for the CIDR portion is always an exact match. For example, both network containers 10.0.0.0/8 and 20.1.0.0/16 are matched by expression '.0' and only 20.1.0.0/16 is matched by '.0/16'.

oneOf.description: network: The network address in IPv4 Address/CIDR format. For regular expression searches, only the IPv4 Address portion is supported. Searches for the CIDR portion is always an exact match. For example, both network containers 10.0.0.0/8 and 20.1.0.0/16 are matched by expression '.0' and only 20.1.0.0/16 is matched by '.0/16'.

network: The network address in IPv4 Address/CIDR format. For regular expression searches, only the IPv4 Address portion is supported. Searches for the CIDR portion is always an exact match. For example, both network containers 10.0.0.0/8 and 20.1.0.0/16 are matched by expression '.0' and only 20.1.0.0/16 is matched by '.0/16'.

_object_ref.description: A WAPI object reference on which the function calls. Either _object or _object_ref must be set.

network_container.description: The network container to which this network belongs (if any).

network_view.description: The name of the network view in which this network resides.

nextserver.description: The name in FQDN and/or IPv4 Address of the next server that the host needs to boot.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

pxe_lease_time.description: The PXE lease time value of a DHCP Network object. Some hosts use PXE (Preboot Execution Environment) to boot remotely from a server. To better manage your IP resources, set a different lease time for PXE boot requests. You can configure the DHCP server to allocate an IP address with a shorter lease time to hosts that send PXE boot requests, so IP addresses are not leased longer than necessary. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

recycle_leases.description: If the field is set to True, the leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after expiration. Otherwise, the leases are permanently deleted.

rir.description: The registry (RIR) that allocated the network address space.

rir_organization.description: The RIR organization assoicated with the network.

rir_registration_status.description: The registration status of the network in RIR.

same_port_control_discovery_blackout.description: If the field is set to True, the discovery blackout setting will be used for port control blackout setting.

send_rir_request.description: Determines whether to send the RIR registration request.

static_hosts.description: The number of static DHCP addresses configured in the network.

template.description: If set on creation, the network is created according to the values specified in the selected template.

total_hosts.description: The total number of DHCP addresses configured in the network.

unmanaged.description: Determines whether the DHCP IPv4 Network is unmanaged or not.

unmanaged_count.description: The number of unmanaged IP addresses as discovered by network discovery.

update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: This field controls whether the DHCP server updates DNS when a DHCP lease is renewed.

use_blackout_setting.description: Use flag for: discovery_blackout_setting , port_control_blackout_setting, same_port_control_discovery_blackout

utilization_update.description: The timestamp when the utilization statistics were last updated.

vlans.description: List of VLANs assigned to Network.

zone_associations.description: The list of zones associated with this network.

delegated_member.description: The Cloud Platform Appliance to which authority of the object is delegated.

delegated_scope.description: Indicates the scope of delegation for the object. This can be one of the following: NONE (outside any delegation), ROOT (the delegation point), SUBTREE (within the scope of a delegation), RECLAIMING (within the scope of a delegation being reclaimed, either as the delegation point or in the subtree).

delegated_root.description: Indicates the root of the delegation if delegated_scope is SUBTREE or RECLAIMING. This is not set otherwise.

owned_by_adaptor.description: Determines whether the object was created by the cloud adapter or not.

usage.description: Indicates the cloud origin of the object.

tenant.description: Reference to the tenant object associated with the object, if any.

mgmt_platform.description: Indicates the specified cloud management platform.

authority_type.description: Type of authority over the object.

ipv4addr.description: The IPv4 Address of the Grid Member.

ipv6addr.description: The IPv6 Address of the Grid Member.

port_scanning.description: Determines whether port scanning is enabled or not.

device_profile.description: Determines whether device profile is enabled or not.

snmp_collection.description: Determines whether SNMP collection is enabled or not.

cli_collection.description: Determines whether CLI collection is enabled or not.

netbios_scanning.description: Determines whether netbios scanning is enabled or not.

complete_ping_sweep.description: Determines whether complete ping sweep is enabled or not.

smart_subnet_ping_sweep.description: Determines whether smart subnet ping sweep is enabled or not.

auto_arp_refresh_before_switch_port_poll.description: Determines whether auto ARP refresh before switch port polling is enabled or not.

switch_port_data_collection_polling.description: A switch port data collection polling mode.

switch_port_data_collection_polling_sche.description: A Schedule Setting struct that determines switch port data collection polling schedule.

switch_port_data_collection_polling_inte.description: Indicates the interval for switch port data collection polling.

weekdays.description: Days of the week when scheduling is triggered.

time_zone.description: The time zone for the schedule.

recurring_time.description: The recurring time for the schedule in Epoch seconds format. This field is obsolete and is preserved only for backward compatibility purposes. Please use other applicable fields to define the recurring schedule. DO NOT use recurring_time together with these fields. If you use recurring_time with other fields to define the recurring schedule, recurring_time has priority over year, hour_of_day, and minutes_past_hour and will override the values of these fields, although it does not override month and day_of_month. In this case, the recurring time value might be different than the intended value that you define.

frequency.description: The frequency for the scheduled task.

every.description: The number of frequency to wait before repeating the scheduled task.

minutes_past_hour.description: The minutes past the hour for the scheduled task.

hour_of_day.description: The hour of day for the scheduled task.

year.description: The year for the scheduled task.

month.description: The month for the scheduled task.

day_of_month.description: The day of the month for the scheduled task.

repeat.description: Indicates if the scheduled task will be repeated or run only once.

disable.description: If set to True, the scheduled task is disabled.

enable_blackout.description: Determines whether a blackout is enabled or not.

blackout_duration.description: The blackout duration in seconds; minimum value is 1 minute.

blackout_schedule.description: A Schedule Setting struct that determines blackout schedule.

weekdays.description: Days of the week when scheduling is triggered.

time_zone.description: The time zone for the schedule.

recurring_time.description: The recurring time for the schedule in Epoch seconds format. This field is obsolete and is preserved only for backward compatibility purposes. Please use other applicable fields to define the recurring schedule. DO NOT use recurring_time together with these fields. If you use recurring_time with other fields to define the recurring schedule, recurring_time has priority over year, hour_of_day, and minutes_past_hour and will override the values of these fields, although it does not override month and day_of_month. In this case, the recurring time value might be different than the intended value that you define.

frequency.description: The frequency for the scheduled task.

every.description: The number of frequency to wait before repeating the scheduled task.

minutes_past_hour.description: The minutes past the hour for the scheduled task.

hour_of_day.description: The hour of day for the scheduled task.

year.description: The year for the scheduled task.

month.description: The month for the scheduled task.

day_of_month.description: The day of the month for the scheduled task.

repeat.description: Indicates if the scheduled task will be repeated or run only once.

disable.description: If set to True, the scheduled task is disabled.

trigger_value.description: Indicates the percentage point which triggers the email/SNMP trap sending.

reset_value.description: Indicates the percentage point which resets the email/SNMP trap sending.

enable_email_warnings.description: Determines whether sending warnings by email is enabled or not.

authority.description: Authority for the DHCP network container.

auto_create_reversezone.description: This flag controls whether reverse zones are automatically created when the network is added.

bootfile.description: The boot server IPv4 Address or name in FQDN format for the network container. You can specify the name and/or IP address of the boot server that the host needs to boot.

bootserver.description: The bootserver address for the network container. You can specify the name and/or IP address of the boot server that the host needs to boot. The boot server IPv4 Address or name in FQDN format.

comment.description: Comment for the network container; maximum 256 characters.

ddns_domainname.description: The dynamic DNS domain name the appliance uses specifically for DDNS updates for this network container.

ddns_generate_hostname.description: If this field is set to True, the DHCP server generates a hostname and updates DNS with it when the DHCP client request does not contain a hostname.

ddns_server_always_updates.description: This field controls whether the DHCP server is allowed to update DNS, regardless of the DHCP client requests. Note that changes for this field take effect only if ddns_use_option81 is True.

ddns_ttl.description: The DNS update Time to Live (TTL) value of a DHCP network container object. The TTL is a 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

ddns_update_fixed_addresses.description: By default, the DHCP server does not update DNS when it allocates a fixed address to a client. You can configure the DHCP server to update the A and PTR records of a client with a fixed address. When this feature is enabled and the DHCP server adds A and PTR records for a fixed address, the DHCP server never discards the records.

ddns_use_option81.description: The support for DHCP Option 81 at the network container level.

delete_reason.description: The reason for deleting the RIR registration request.

deny_bootp.description: If set to True, BOOTP settings are disabled and BOOTP requests will be denied.

discover_now_status.description: Discover now status for this network container.

discovery_member.description: The member that will run discovery for this network container.

email_list.description: The e-mail lists to which the appliance sends DHCP threshold alarm e-mail messages.

enable_ddns.description: The dynamic DNS updates flag of a DHCP network container object. If set to True, the DHCP server sends DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid, and to external DNS servers.

enable_dhcp_thresholds.description: Determines if DHCP thresholds are enabled for the network container.

enable_discovery.description: Determines whether a discovery is enabled or not for this network container. When this is set to False, the network container discovery is disabled.

enable_email_warnings.description: Determines if DHCP threshold warnings are sent through email.

enable_immediate_discovery.description: Determines if the discovery for the network container should be immediately enabled.

enable_pxe_lease_time.description: Set this to True if you want the DHCP server to use a different lease time for PXE clients.

enable_snmp_warnings.description: Determines if DHCP threshold warnings are send through SNMP.

endpoint_sources.description: The endpoints that provides data for the DHCP Network Container object.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

federated_realms.description: This field contains the federated realms associated to this network container.

high_water_mark.description: The percentage of DHCP network container usage threshold above which network container usage is not expected and may warrant your attention. When the high watermark is reached, the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

high_water_mark_reset.description: The percentage of DHCP network container usage below which the corresponding SNMP trap is reset. A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The high watermark reset value must be lower than the high watermark value.

ignore_dhcp_option_list_request.description: If this field is set to False, the appliance returns all DHCP options the client is eligible to receive, rather than only the list of options the client has requested.

ignore_id.description: Indicates whether the appliance will ignore DHCP client IDs or MAC addresses.

ignore_mac_addresses.description: A list of MAC addresses the appliance will ignore.

ipam_email_addresses.description: The e-mail lists to which the appliance sends IPAM threshold alarm e-mail messages.

last_rir_registration_update_sent.description: The timestamp when the last RIR registration update was sent.

lease_scavenge_time.description: An integer that specifies the period of time (in seconds) that frees and backs up leases remained in the database before they are automatically deleted. To disable lease scavenging, set the parameter to -1. The minimum positive value must be greater than 86400 seconds (1 day).

logic_filter_rules.description: This field contains the logic filters to be applied on the this network container. This list corresponds to the match rules that are written to the dhcpd configuration file.

low_water_mark.description: The percentage of DHCP network container usage below which the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

low_water_mark_reset.description: The percentage of DHCP network container usage threshold below which network container usage is not expected and may warrant your attention. When the low watermark is crossed, the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The low watermark reset value must be higher than the low watermark value.

mgm_private.description: This field controls whether this object is synchronized with the Multi-Grid Master. If this field is set to True, objects are not synchronized.

mgm_private_overridable.description: This field is assumed to be True unless filled by any conforming objects, such as Network, IPv6 Network, Network Container, IPv6 Network Container, and Network View. This value is set to False if mgm_private is set to True in the parent object.

network.description: The network address in IPv4 Address/CIDR format. For regular expression searches, only the IPv4 Address portion is supported. Searches for the CIDR portion is always an exact match. For example, both network containers 10.0.0.0/8 and 20.1.0.0/16 are matched by expression '.0' and only 20.1.0.0/16 is matched by '.0/16'.

oneOf.description: networkcontainer: The network address in IPv4 Address/CIDR format. For regular expression searches, only the IPv4 Address portion is supported. Searches for the CIDR portion is always an exact match. For example, both network containers 10.0.0.0/8 and 20.1.0.0/16 are matched by expression '.0' and only 20.1.0.0/16 is matched by '.0/16'.

networkcontainer: The network address in IPv4 Address/CIDR format. For regular expression searches, only the IPv4 Address portion is supported. Searches for the CIDR portion is always an exact match. For example, both network containers 10.0.0.0/8 and 20.1.0.0/16 are matched by expression '.0' and only 20.1.0.0/16 is matched by '.0/16'.

_object_ref.description: A WAPI object reference on which the function calls. Either _object or _object_ref must be set.

network_container.description: The network container to which this network belongs, if any.

network_view.description: The name of the network view in which this network resides.

nextserver.description: The name in FQDN and/or IPv4 Address of the next server that the host needs to boot.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

pxe_lease_time.description: The PXE lease time value of a DHCP Network container object. Some hosts use PXE (Preboot Execution Environment) to boot remotely from a server. To better manage your IP resources, set a different lease time for PXE boot requests. You can configure the DHCP server to allocate an IP address with a shorter lease time to hosts that send PXE boot requests, so IP addresses are not leased longer than necessary. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

recycle_leases.description: If the field is set to True, the leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after expiration. Otherwise, the leases are permanently deleted.

remove_subnets.description: Remove subnets delete option. Determines whether all child objects should be removed alongside with the network container or child objects should be assigned to another parental container. By default child objects are deleted with the network container.

rir.description: The registry (RIR) that allocated the network container address space.

rir_organization.description: The RIR organization assoicated with the network container.

rir_registration_status.description: The registration status of the network container in RIR.

same_port_control_discovery_blackout.description: If the field is set to True, the discovery blackout setting will be used for port control blackout setting.

send_rir_request.description: Determines whether to send the RIR registration request.

unmanaged.description: Determines whether the network container is unmanaged or not.

update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: This field controls whether the DHCP server updates DNS when a DHCP lease is renewed.

use_blackout_setting.description: Use flag for: discovery_blackout_setting , port_control_blackout_setting, same_port_control_discovery_blackout

utilization.description: The network container utilization in percentage.

zone_associations.description: The list of zones associated with this network.

delegated_member.description: The Cloud Platform Appliance to which authority of the object is delegated.

delegated_scope.description: Indicates the scope of delegation for the object. This can be one of the following: NONE (outside any delegation), ROOT (the delegation point), SUBTREE (within the scope of a delegation), RECLAIMING (within the scope of a delegation being reclaimed, either as the delegation point or in the subtree).

delegated_root.description: Indicates the root of the delegation if delegated_scope is SUBTREE or RECLAIMING. This is not set otherwise.

owned_by_adaptor.description: Determines whether the object was created by the cloud adapter or not.

usage.description: Indicates the cloud origin of the object.

tenant.description: Reference to the tenant object associated with the object, if any.

mgmt_platform.description: Indicates the specified cloud management platform.

authority_type.description: Type of authority over the object.

ipv6addr.description: The IPv6 Address of the Grid Member.

snmp_collection.description: Determines whether SNMP collection is enabled or not.

netbios_scanning.description: Determines whether netbios scanning is enabled or not.

auto_create_reversezone.description: This flag controls whether reverse zones are automatically created when the network is added.

bootfile.description: The boot server IPv4 Address or name in FQDN format for the network. You can specify the name and/or IP address of the boot server that the host needs to boot.

bootserver.description: The bootserver address for the network. You can specify the name and/or IP address of the boot server that the host needs to boot. The boot server IPv4 Address or name in FQDN format.

auto_create_reversezone.description: This flag controls whether reverse zones are automatically created when the network is added.

comment.description: Comment for the network; maximum 256 characters.

ddns_domainname.description: The dynamic DNS domain name the appliance uses specifically for DDNS updates for this network.

ddns_enable_option_fqdn.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the ddns_enable_option_fqdn flag of a DHCP IPv6 Network object. This method controls whether the FQDN option sent by the client is to be used, or if the server can automatically generate the FQDN. This setting overrides the upper-level settings.

ddns_generate_hostname.description: If this field is set to True, the DHCP server generates a hostname and updates DNS with it when the DHCP client request does not contain a hostname.

ddns_server_always_updates.description: This field controls whether only the DHCP server is allowed to update DNS, regardless of the DHCP clients requests. Note that changes for this field take effect only if ddns_enable_option_fqdn is True.

ddns_ttl.description: The DNS update Time to Live (TTL) value of a DHCP network object. The TTL is a 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

delete_reason.description: The reason for deleting the RIR registration request.

disable.description: Determines whether a network is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the network is enabled.

discover_now_status.description: Discover now status for this network.

discovered_bgp_as.description: Number of the discovered BGP AS. When multiple BGP autonomous systems are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovered_vlan_id.description: The identifier of the discovered VLAN. When multiple VLANs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovered_vlan_name.description: The name of the discovered VLAN. When multiple VLANs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovered_vrf_description.description: Description of the discovered VRF. When multiple VRFs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovered_vrf_name.description: The name of the discovered VRF. When multiple VRFs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovered_vrf_rd.description: Route distinguisher of the discovered VRF. When multiple VRFs are discovered in the network, this field displays "Multiple".

discovery_member.description: The member that will run discovery for this network.

domain_name.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the domain_name value of a DHCP IPv6 Network object.

domain_name_servers.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the dynamic DNS updates flag of a DHCP IPv6 Network object. The DHCP server can send DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid and to external DNS servers. This setting overrides the member level settings.

enable_ddns.description: The dynamic DNS updates flag of a DHCP IPv6 network object. If set to True, the DHCP server sends DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid, and to external DNS servers.

enable_discovery.description: Determines whether a discovery is enabled or not for this network. When this is set to False, the network discovery is disabled.

enable_ifmap_publishing.description: Determines if IFMAP publishing is enabled for the network.

enable_immediate_discovery.description: Determines if the discovery for the network should be immediately enabled.

endpoint_sources.description: The endpoints that provides data for the DHCP IPv6 Network object.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

federated_realms.description: This field contains the federated realms associated to this network

last_rir_registration_update_sent.description: The timestamp when the last RIR registration update was sent.

logic_filter_rules.description: This field contains the logic filters to be applied on this IPv6 network. This list corresponds to the match rules that are written to the DHCPv6 configuration file.

members.description: A list of members servers that serve DHCP for the network. All members in the array must be of the same type. The struct type must be indicated in each element, by setting the "_struct" member to the struct type.

mgm_private.description: This field controls whether this object is synchronized with the Multi-Grid Master. If this field is set to True, objects are not synchronized.

mgm_private_overridable.description: This field is assumed to be True unless filled by any conforming objects, such as Network, IPv6 Network, Network Container, IPv6 Network Container, and Network View. This value is set to False if mgm_private is set to True in the parent object.

network.description: The network address in IPv6 Address/CIDR format. For regular expression searches, only the IPv6 Address portion is supported. Searches for the CIDR portion is always an exact match. For example, both network containers 16::0/28 and 26::0/24 are matched by expression '.6' and only 26::0/24 is matched by '.6/24'.

network_container.description: The network container to which this network belongs, if any.

network_view.description: The name of the network view in which this network resides.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

preferred_lifetime.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the preferred lifetime value of a DHCP IPv6 Network object.

recycle_leases.description: If the field is set to True, the leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after expiration. Otherwise, the leases are permanently deleted.

rir.description: The registry (RIR) that allocated the IPv6 network address space.

rir_organization.description: The RIR organization associated with the IPv6 network.

rir_registration_status.description: The registration status of the IPv6 network in RIR.

same_port_control_discovery_blackout.description: If the field is set to True, the discovery blackout setting will be used for port control blackout setting.

send_rir_request.description: Determines whether to send the RIR registration request.

template.description: If set on creation, the network is created according to the values specified in the selected template.

unmanaged.description: Determines whether the DHCP IPv6 Network is unmanaged or not.

unmanaged_count.description: The number of unmanaged IP addresses as discovered by network discovery.

use_blackout_setting.description: Use flag for: discovery_blackout_setting , port_control_blackout_setting, same_port_control_discovery_blackout

is_default.description: True if this is the default zone.

view.description: The view to which the zone belongs. If a view is not specified, the default view is used.

allow_any_netmask.description: This flag controls whether the template allows any netmask. You must specify a netmask when creating a network using this template. If you set this parameter to False, you must specify the "cidr" field for the network template object.

auto_create_reversezone.description: This flag controls whether reverse zones are automatically created when the network is added.

cidr.description: The CIDR of the network in CIDR format.

cloud_api_compatible.description: This flag controls whether this template can be used to create network objects in a cloud-computing deployment.

comment.description: Comment for the network; maximum 256 characters.

ddns_domainname.description: The dynamic DNS domain name the appliance uses specifically for DDNS updates for this network.

ddns_enable_option_fqdn.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the ddns_enable_option_fqdn flag of a DHCP IPv6 Network object. This method controls whether the FQDN option sent by the client is to be used, or if the server can automatically generate the FQDN. This setting overrides the upper-level settings.

ddns_generate_hostname.description: If this field is set to True, the DHCP server generates a hostname and updates DNS with it when the DHCP client request does not contain a hostname.

ddns_server_always_updates.description: This field controls whether the DHCP server is allowed to update DNS, regardless of the DHCP client requests. Note that changes for this field take effect only if ddns_enable_option_fqdn is True.

ddns_ttl.description: The DNS update Time to Live (TTL) value of a DHCP network object. The TTL is a 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

domain_name.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the domain_name value of a DHCP IPv6 Network object.

domain_name_servers.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the dynamic DNS updates flag of a DHCP IPv6 Network object. The DHCP server can send DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid and to external DNS servers. This setting overrides the member level settings.

enable_ddns.description: The dynamic DNS updates flag of a DHCP IPv6 network object. If set to True, the DHCP server sends DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid, and to external DNS servers.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

fixed_address_templates.description: The list of IPv6 fixed address templates assigned to this IPv6 network template object. When you create an IPv6 network based on an IPv6 network template object that contains IPv6 fixed address templates, the IPv6 fixed addresses are created based on the associated IPv6 fixed address templates.

ipv6prefix.description: The IPv6 Address prefix of the DHCP IPv6 network.

logic_filter_rules.description: This field contains the logic filters to be applied on this IPv6 network template. This list corresponds to the match rules that are written to the DHCPv6 configuration file.

members.description: A list of members that serve DHCP for the network. All members in the array must be of the same type. The struct type must be indicated in each element, by setting the "_struct" member to the struct type.

name.description: The name of this IPv6 network template.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

preferred_lifetime.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the preferred lifetime value of a DHCP IPv6 Network object.

range_templates.description: The list of IPv6 address range templates assigned to this IPv6 network template object. When you create an IPv6 network based on an IPv6 network template object that contains IPv6 range templates, the IPv6 address ranges are created based on the associated IPv6 address range templates.

recycle_leases.description: If the field is set to True, the leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after expiration. Otherwise, the leases are permanently deleted.

rir.description: The registry (RIR) that allocated the IPv6 network address space.

rir_organization.description: The RIR organization associated with the IPv6 network.

rir_registration_action.description: The action for the RIR registration.

rir_registration_status.description: The registration status of the IPv6 network in RIR.

send_rir_request.description: Determines whether to send the RIR registration request.

update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: This field controls whether the DHCP server updates DNS when a DHCP lease is renewed.

valid_lifetime.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the valid lifetime value of a DHCP IPv6 Network object.

ipv4addr.description: The IPv4 Address of the Grid Member.

ipv6addr.description: The IPv6 Address of the Grid Member.

type.description: The filter type. Valid values are: * MAC * NAC * Option

ipv4addr.description: The IPv4 Address of the Grid Member.

ipv6addr.description: The IPv6 Address of the Grid Member.

num.description: The code of the DHCP option.

vendor_class.description: The name of the space this DHCP option is associated to.

use_option.description: Only applies to special options that are displayed separately from other options and have a use flag. These options are: * routers * router-templates * domain-name-servers * domain-name * broadcast-address * broadcast-address-offset * dhcp-lease-time * dhcp6.name-servers

reverse.description: The reverse flag of the BulkHost record.

start_addr.description: The first IP address in the address range for the bulk host.

template_format.description: The bulk host name template format.

view.description: The view for the bulk host.

delegated_scope.description: Indicates the scope of delegation for the object. This can be one of the following: NONE (outside any delegation), ROOT (the delegation point), SUBTREE (within the scope of a delegation), RECLAIMING (within the scope of a delegation being reclaimed, either as the delegation point or in the subtree).

delegated_root.description: Indicates the root of the delegation if delegated_scope is SUBTREE or RECLAIMING. This is not set otherwise.

owned_by_adaptor.description: Determines whether the object was created by the cloud adapter or not.

usage.description: Indicates the cloud origin of the object.

tenant.description: Reference to the tenant object associated with the object, if any.

mgmt_platform.description: Indicates the specified cloud management platform.

authority_type.description: Type of authority over the object.

disable_ip_scanning.description: Determines whether IP scanning is disabled.

disable_vmware_scanning.description: Determines whether VMWare scanning is disabled.

member_name.description: The Grid member that runs the discovery.

merge_data.description: Determines whether to replace or merge new data with existing data.

network_view.description: Name of the network view in which target networks for network discovery reside.

networks.description: The list of the networks on which the network discovery will be invoked.

ping_retries.description: The number of times to perfrom ping for ICMP and FULL modes.

ping_timeout.description: The ping timeout for ICMP and FULL modes.

state_time.description: Time when the network discovery process state was last updated.

status.description: The network discovery process descriptive status.

status_time.description: The time when the network discovery process status was last updated.

tcp_ports.description: The ports to scan for FULL and TCP modes.

tcp_scan_technique.description: The TCP scan techinque for FULL and TCP modes.

v_network_view.description: Name of the network view in which target networks for VMWare scanning reside.

vservers.description: The list of VMware vSphere servers for VM discovery.

weekdays.description: Days of the week when scheduling is triggered.

time_zone.description: The time zone for the schedule.

recurring_time.description: The recurring time for the schedule in Epoch seconds format. This field is obsolete and is preserved only for backward compatibility purposes. Please use other applicable fields to define the recurring schedule. DO NOT use recurring_time together with these fields. If you use recurring_time with other fields to define the recurring schedule, recurring_time has priority over year, hour_of_day, and minutes_past_hour and will override the values of these fields, although it does not override month and day_of_month. In this case, the recurring time value might be different than the intended value that you define.

frequency.description: The frequency for the scheduled task.

every.description: The number of frequency to wait before repeating the scheduled task.

minutes_past_hour.description: The minutes past the hour for the scheduled task.

hour_of_day.description: The hour of day for the scheduled task.

year.description: The year for the scheduled task.

month.description: The month for the scheduled task.

day_of_month.description: The day of the month for the scheduled task.

repeat.description: Indicates if the scheduled task will be repeated or run only once.

disable.description: If set to True, the scheduled task is disabled.

port.description: The connection port that the vSphere server uses.

username.description: The user name on the vSphere server.
